meanings.definition: A very short period of time.
meanings.sent1: In just a few jiffies, the bus arrived at the stop.
meanings.sent2: She finished her homework in a couple of jiffies.
meanings.sent3: He claimed he could eat a whole pizza in a jiffy!
meanings.sent4: The magician made the rabbit disappear in a jiffy.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm passed by in a jiffy, leaving clear skies.

meanings.sent1: With a quick flick of the switch, the lights turned on in a jiffy.
meanings.sent2: The cat caught the mouse in a jiffy.
meanings.sent3: She made up her mind in a jiffy, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The idea popped into his head in a jiffy, like a light bulb turning on.
meanings.sent5: The car sped past in a jiffy, leaving dust in its wake.
